intro: Pterichis widgrenii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pterichis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and a distinctive central column. Pterichis widgrenii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
